diagnosis.primary: Invasive Ductal Carcinoma (IDC) of the Right Breast
diagnosis.priorHistory: Patient with pT1c pN0 M0, Stage IA, ER+/PR+/HER2- IDC, s/p Lumpectomy + SLNB (Jan 2025) and Adjuvant WBRT 42.56 Gy / 16 fx (completed Feb 2025).
pathologyFindings: Original Diagnosis: Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, Nottingham Grade 2.
Receptor Status: ER Positive, PR Positive, HER2 Negative.
Stage: pT1c pN0(sn) M0, Stage IA.

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) - Electron Boost
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV_Boost (Lumpectomy Cavity + margin, defined on planning CT/prior imaging)
treatmentPlan.techniqueSummary: Electrons (Direct en face field in lateral decubitus position)
medications: Continue Topical Steroid Cream/Aquaphor PRN skin reaction
therapistAlerts: Patient in Left Lateral Decubitus position for this boost plan.
Verify boost field outline on skin daily.
Assess skin reaction from prior WBRT.

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Patient positioned in left lateral decubitus position on a flat tabletop, with right arm abducted. This presents the lateral aspect of the right breast en face to the gantry. SSD setup.
ctSimulation.immobilization: Custom Vac-Lok bag molded to patient in lateral decubitus position for reproducible setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: Using prior WBRT tattoos and new clinical markup on skin/bolus for lateral boost field placement. Isocenter placed on skin surface.
ctSimulation.scanner: N/A (Clinical setup verification, original supine CT used for contouring)
ctSimulation.ctNotes: Boost plan generated based on lumpectomy cavity contoured on original WBRT simulation CT from Feb 2025. Today's session for clinical setup verification in lateral decubitus position.

dosimetry.planStatus: Final - Approved by Dr. Angela Rossi
dosimetry.isoCoords: Surface setup at center of boost field
dosimetry.planNotes: Sequential electron boost. Lateral decubitus position used for en face setup to lateral scar/cavity.

igrtProtocol.alignment: Align field light to skin markings. Verify SSD.

fractions.setupNotes: Patient setup in L lateral decubitus position in custom Vac-Lok. Setup verified to field outline. SSD check performed.
fractions.sideEffects: Skin reaction stable/slightly improved from WBRT peak.
Skin reaction resolving. No new issues.
fractions.notes: Completed final boost treatment. Total dose 52.56 Gy (WBRT+Boost).

imagingAndReports.summary: Original WBRT simulation scan (supine). Lumpectomy cavity identified and wired/contoured. Used for boost planning.
Images confirming accurate setup for boost field targeting lumpectomy cavity.

labResults.notes: No specific labs typically required for boost-only RT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Angela Rossi (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient completed 16/16 fx WBRT (42.56 Gy). Tolerated well, Grade 1-2 dermatitis managed with topicals. Plan for sequential boost 10Gy/5fx starting next week. Due to lateral scar, will use lateral decubitus electron setup.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Angela Rossi (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Completed 5/5 boost fx (10 Gy). Total dose 52.56 Gy (WBRT+Boost). Skin reaction resolving. Follow up in 4-6 weeks. Start Letrozole as planned.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Adjuvant boost therapy to provide additional targeted dose to the area of highest recurrence risk (the lumpectomy cavity).
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Continuation or slight worsening of skin reaction from WBRT (redness, dryness), which should then resolve. Fatigue. Minimal additional risk beyond the initial WBRT. Explained lateral decubitus setup for treatment.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Continue skin care as instructed for WBRT. Importance of holding still in the side-lying position during treatment.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT appointments for the boost week, continue skin care.
